elements.title: Akinada Tobishima Kaido (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Akinada Tobishima Kaido (bridge pictured), an island-hopping road, was named after its resemblance to stepping stones in a garden?

elements.title: Bjarne Store-Jakobsen (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the "mythical love story" of Sami politician Bjarne Store-Jakobsen and Blackfoot physician Esther Tailfeathers is a focus of the 2014 film Bihttoš?

elements.title: promised victory (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that after Seattle Seahawks quarterback Matt Hasselbeck promised victory, he threw an interception that lost the game?

elements.title: Wu shu (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the compilation of the Wu shu was hampered by the execution of two members of the committee compiling the text?

elements.title: Mercantile Library (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that after after operating for 168 years and moving to three buildings, the Mercantile Library in Philadelphia was closed due to concerns of asbestos?

elements.title: fume hood (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the energy cost of a single fume hood in Singapore can be up to $9,300?

elements.title: Laura Veale (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Laura Veale was the first woman to practise as a doctor in the town of Harrogate?

elements.title: Bissau-Guinean cinema (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that to encourage the development of Bissau-Guinean cinema, one foreign filmmaker provided the country's film institute with cameras, lights, and a Steinbeck guitar?

elements.title: Joel Ross (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that professional vibraphonist Joel Ross has called the vibraphone his "least favorite instrument"?
